devanagari:
गतिर्भूतानामशेषाणां
सिद्धिर्बुद्धिः च मतिर्मम।
अहं च सर्वभूतानां
सिद्धिर्बुद्धिः च मतिर्मम॥ ९ ॥
transliteration:
gatir bhūtānām aśeṣāṇāṁ
siddhir buddhiḥ ca matir mama
ahaṁ ca sarva-bhūtānām
siddhir buddhiḥ ca matir mama
translation: I am the goal of all living entities, the intelligence of the intelligent, and the strength of the strong.
purport: In this verse, Lord Krishna identifies Himself as the ultimate goal of all living entities. This highlights the purpose of life, which is to realize and connect with the Supreme Lord. Krishna also describes Himself as the intelligence of the intelligent and the strength of the strong, indicating that all qualities and abilities stem from Him. This understanding encourages devotees to seek knowledge and strength through their connection with Krishna, recognizing that true intelligence and power are derived from Him. By acknowledging Krishna as the source of all virtues, individuals can cultivate a deeper devotion and align their lives with divine purpose, ultimately leading to spiritual fulfillment.
